intro: Ceratostema weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, surrounded by colorful bracts that give it a striking appearance. It is typically found in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
